text: yeah only one thing beats watching
sports and high-definition watching
sports in high definition that you
filmed yourself this week in the times I
reviewed 2 camcorders that are radical
in two ways they film in high definition
and they record on two hard drives
instead of tapes no rewinding or
fast-forwarding ever instead all your
scenes show up on a table of contents
you just tap one for instant access Sony
is 1,300 bucks when it hits the streets
next month it'll be a couple hundred
dollars lower than that I like it
because it's small its compact and very
crisp with zooming and focusing the JVC
ought to be a killer camera it's four
hundred dollars more it has three C CDs
that means three chips one each for red
green and blue it's supposed to give you
much better color than a single-chip
camera unfortunately I couldn't see any
difference in color at all what's worse
this camera has a serious problem with
its image stabilizer and that's a big
problem on a widescreen format like HDTV
look how the Sony does a much better job
of ironing out the jitters on this chair
there is however a dark side to hard
drive camcorders what are you going to
do when hard drive fills up can't
exactly duck into a Walmart to buy a new
blank hard drive to slip in there both
companies expect that you'll dump the
video onto your computer unfortunately
Sony uses a new video format that
doesn't work with Max or most editing
programs although it does come with
software that copies the video on to
blank regular dvds which then play in
high definition on a Playstation 3 or a
blu-ray DVD player
the jvc on the other hand has a couple
of tricks up its sleeve for one thing it
can impersonate a regular tape camcorder
therefore you can hook it up to any kind
of computer Mac renews whatever and use
any editing program you want or you can
buy this thing it's a burner that once
again uses regular blank dvds once again
it can play back your home movies in
high definition it's not blu-ray it's
not HD DVD but it's real high def on
regular blank dvds these camcorders both
advance the state of the art but they're
both flawed I'm not sure I wouldn't
prefer a high-definition tape camcorder
you get the same spectacular picture
maybe even a little better picture
without having to mess with emptying
that hard drive out every time it fills
up still any step into the new world of
hi-def video is welcome camcorders like
these let you transform your movie night
into full movie night
